Issues Correctly Identified by the AI.Analysis: AI proposed expanding the definition to include shareholders, syndicate members, and other finance providers. HR implemented a partial fix, adding directors, shareholders, and potential syndicate members.
AI proposed adding exceptions for automated backups and internal work product ('Secondary Information'). HR implemented this change almost exactly as suggested, bringing the clause into compliance.
AI proposed removing the restriction on the recipient's affiliates. HR implemented this change by deleting the reference to 'associated companies or subsidiaries'.

Issues Correctly Identified by the AI.Issue: Prohibition on Acting as a Consortium
Issues Correctly Identified by the AI.Analysis: AI proposed deleting the clause that forced the recipient to act as a sole principal. HR implemented this change by deleting the entire clause.
AI proposed adding an exception for contact made in the ordinary course of business. HR implemented this change by adding the suggested exception.
AI proposed deleting the clause that granted enforceable rights to non-signatories. HR implemented this change by deleting the entire clause.
AI proposed making the one-sided assignment clause mutual. HR implemented this change by replacing the clause with a mutual right of assignment for affiliates.
AI proposed changing the governing law from Dutch to the preferred Belgian law. HR implemented this change exactly as suggested.

Issues Missed by the AI.Issue: Carve-out from Responsibility for Representative Breaches
Issues Missed by the AI.Analysis: AI did not mention this. HR added a specific exception stating the company is not responsible for its Representatives' compliance with the non-solicitation clauses.
AI did not mention this. HR softened a strict obligation to 'procure' action from Representatives to a 'use best efforts to' standard.

Issues Missed by the AI.Issue: Removed Strict Liability for Representative No-Contact Breach
Issues Missed by the AI.Analysis: AI did not mention this specific point in this section. HR removed language that made the company strictly liable for no-contact breaches by its Representatives.

Issues Flagged by AI but Not Addressed b.Analysis: AI identified a clause prohibiting joint proposals and recommended its deletion per Policy 2. HR did not make any change to this section, leaving the problematic clause in place.
AI noted the absence of a mandatory clause limiting liability to direct damages (Policy 1). HR did not add this clause to the agreement.
AI proposed softening the strict liability standard for Representative breaches to a 'best efforts' standard. HR did not implement this change, leaving the stricter language in place.
AI noted the definition of what is not 'Information' was missing a standard exception for information received from a third party. HR did not add this exception.

High Priority.citation: Information may be made available to employees within your organisation (including employees of subsidiaries and affiliates) and to external consultants who are directly involved in the Proposed Transaction... (such persons each a 'Permitted Recipient')
High Priority.problem: The definition of 'Permitted Recipient' is too narrow. It excludes key required parties such as shareholders, potential syndicate members, and other finance providers, which is a violation of Policy 2.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: Information may be disclosed by you to your affiliates and their respective directors, officers, employees, consultants, advisers, shareholders, potential syndicate members, agents, representatives, and other providers of financing (collectively, 'Permitted Recipients'), who need to know such information for the evaluation of and the discussions and negotiations regarding the Proposed Transaction, provided you remain responsible for any breach of this agreement by your Permitted Recipients.

High Priority.citation: The obligation to return or destroy Information shall not apply to the retention of Information, which is required by any applicable law or regulation...
High Priority.problem: The return and destruction clause fails to include mandatory exceptions for information retained on automated backup systems or contained within internal work product ('Secondary Information'), as required by Policy 3.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: Upon a Provider's written request, you shall return or destroy all Information. However, this obligation shall not apply to: (i) Information you or your Permitted Recipients must retain under applicable law, rule, or regulation; (ii) Information saved to electronic media under automatic archiving or data-security procedures; and (iii) reports, notes, or other materials prepared by or on behalf of you that incorporate Information ('Secondary Information'). Any material not returned or destroyed remains subject to this agreement's confidentiality obligations.

High Priority.citation: ...approach any employee or independent service provider... with regard to a job within your company or an associated company or subsidiary of your company...
High Priority.problem: The non-solicitation clause improperly extends the restriction to the recipient's affiliates ('an associated company or subsidiary'). Policy 4 explicitly states that the restriction must not apply to Strada's affiliates or portfolio companies.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: For a period of two (2) years from the date of this agreement, you agree not to directly solicit for employment any employee of the Group with whom you had material contact in connection with the Proposed Transaction. This restriction shall not apply to any of your affiliated portfolio companies, nor to employees who respond to public advertisements, make unsolicited applications, are referred by an unaffiliated recruiter, or whose employment commences more than six (6) months after the date of this agreement.

High Priority.citation: ...enter into or maintain any arrangement with any potential acquirer... in relation to making a joint proposal (or forming any kind of consortium or other co-operation arrangement)...
High Priority.problem: This clause explicitly prohibits forming a consortium or making a joint proposal. Policy 2 mandates that any clause forcing Strada to act alone or prohibiting consortiums must be deleted.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: This clause should be deleted in its entirety.

High Priority.citation: You acknowledge and confirm that you are acting on your own behalf and not as agent, nominee, trustee, broker or as part of a syndicate or consortium...
High Priority.problem: This clause forces the recipient to act as a sole principal and not as part of a consortium. Policy 2 mandates that any clause forcing Strada to act alone must be deleted.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: This clause should be deleted in its entirety.

High Priority.problem: The agreement does not contain a clause limiting liability to direct damages and excluding indirect, consequential, special, or punitive damages, which is a mandatory requirement under Policy 1.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: Liability for a breach of this agreement shall be limited to proven, direct damages. In no event shall either party be liable for any indirect, consequential, special, punitive, or incidental damages, or for any loss of profits, revenue, or data.

Medium Priority.citation: ...contact any current or former directors, officers, employees, agents, advisers or other representatives of the Group or the Sellers nor any customers, distributors, suppliers, clients, lenders, shareholders or other counterparts of the Group...
Medium Priority.problem: The no-contact clause is overly broad, extending to customers, suppliers, and lenders. It also lacks a required exception for contact made in the ordinary course of business, as mandated by Policy 6.
Medium Priority.suggested_replacement: Without the prior written consent of the Providers, you agree not to contact any directors, officers, or employees of the Group in connection with the Proposed Transaction. This restriction shall not be breached by contact made for another purpose than evaluating or negotiating the Proposed Transaction.

Medium Priority.citation: The undertakings given by you under this confidentiality agreement are given to the Company but are also for the benefit of each other Provider, as an irrevocable third-party stipulation...
Medium Priority.problem: This clause explicitly grants enforceable rights to non-signatories ('each other Provider'), which is a direct violation of Policy 7.
Medium Priority.suggested_replacement: This clause should be deleted in its entirety.

Medium Priority.citation: You shall not directly or indirectly assign or transfer... without the prior written consent of the Company. The Company is entitled to assign or transfer... to any of its affiliates or third parties...
Medium Priority.problem: The assignment clause is a one-sided restriction, prohibiting the recipient from assigning its rights while allowing the Company to do so freely. Policy 9 requires that such restrictions not be one-sided.
Medium Priority.suggested_replacement: Each party may assign or transfer its rights and obligations under this agreement to any of its affiliates without the prior written consent of the other party.

Low Priority.citation: You remain fully responsible and accountable for the compliance of the Permitted Recipients with the provisions of this confidentiality agreement.
Low Priority.problem: This clause imposes strict liability for breaches by Representatives. Policy 13 expresses a preference for a softer, efforts-based standard.
Low Priority.suggested_replacement: You will use your best efforts to procure that each of your Permitted Recipients who receives any Information is aware of and adheres to the terms of this agreement. You shall be responsible for any breach of the confidentiality obligations of this agreement by your Permitted Recipients.

Low Priority.citation: ...is already in or comes into your lawful possession without breach of this confidentiality agreement (as evidenced by you by written records)...
Low Priority.problem: The definition of what is not 'Information' is incomplete. It fails to explicitly include the standard market exception for information received from a third party not under an obligation of confidentiality, as specified in Policy 14.
Low Priority.suggested_replacement: Information does not include information that: (a) is or becomes generally available to the public through no breach by you of the confidentiality undertakings hereunder; (b) was in your lawful possession before receipt from a Provider, without any obligation of confidentiality; (c) was received in good faith by you from a third party not under an obligation of confidentiality to a Provider; or (d) was disclosed by you with the written permission of an authorized representative of the Provider.

Low Priority.citation: ...shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Netherlands. Any disputes... shall be submitted to the exclusive jurisdiction of the District Court in Amsterdam, the Netherlands.
Low Priority.problem: The agreement specifies Dutch law and Amsterdam courts. While this is an acceptable European jurisdiction, it deviates from the playbook's stated preference for Belgian law and the courts of Antwerp, as per Policy 11.
Low Priority.suggested_replacement: This agreement, and any contractual or non-contractual obligations arising out of or in connection with it, shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Belgium. Any disputes arising out of or in connection with this agreement shall be submitted to the exclusive jurisdiction of the competent courts in Antwerp, division Antwerp, Belgium.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with High Priority Policy 2
hr_edits_data.citation: Context: 'Information may be made available to ++[directors and]++ employees within your organisation (including ++[directors and]++ employees of subsidiaries and affiliates) and to ++[shareholders, potential syndicate members or]++ external consultants...'
hr_edits_data.problem: The definition of 'Permitted Recipient' was expanded to include 'directors', 'shareholders', and 'potential syndicate members'. This is a positive change that aligns with High Priority Policy 2, which requires a broad definition of who can receive confidential information.

hr_edits_data.citation: Context: '...You remain fully responsible and accountable for the compliance of the Permitted Recipients with the provisions of this confidentiality agreement, ++ [except for clause 11 and 12]++.'
hr_edits_data.problem: An exception was added, stating that Strada is not responsible for its Representatives' compliance with the non-solicitation clauses (11 and 12). While this is favorable to Strada, it is not a standard modification prescribed by the playbook. Policy 13 suggests taking responsibility for all breaches by Representatives.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with Low Priority Policy 13
hr_edits_data.citation: Context: '...and you will, and ++[use best efforts to]++ procure that the Permitted Recipients will, (i) use best efforts to obtain a protective order...'
hr_edits_data.problem: The strict obligation to 'procure' that Representatives take certain actions was softened to a 'use best efforts to' standard. This aligns with the principle of Low Priority Policy 13, which favors efforts-based standards over strict liability for the actions of Representatives.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with High Priority Policy 3
hr_edits_data.citation: Context: 'The obligation to return or destroy Information shall not apply to [++(i) Information and elaborations thereof as have been saved to electronic carriers under automatic archiving or data security procedures, (ii) reports, notes or other materials prepared by you or on your behalf which incorporate Information (the '**Secondary Information**'), (iii)++] the retention of Information, which is required by any applicable law or regulation...'
hr_edits_data.problem: Exceptions to the obligation to destroy confidential information were added. These exceptions cover automated backups, internal work product ('Secondary Information'), and retention for legal/regulatory compliance. This change brings the clause into full compliance with High Priority Policy 3.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with High Priority Policy 4
hr_edits_data.citation: Original: 'For a period of --two -- year... approach any employee... within the Group --or within one of its associated companies or subsidiaries--...' New: 'For a period of ++[one]++ year... approach any employee... within the Group...'
hr_edits_data.problem: The non-solicitation of employees clause was modified. The term was reduced from two years to one (compliant with the max 2-year term), and the restriction was removed from applying to 'associated companies or subsidiaries'. These changes align the clause with the requirements of High Priority Policy 4.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with Low Priority Policy 13
hr_edits_data.citation: Context: 'You agree not to,-- and procure that no Permitted Recipient will,--without the prior written consent of CFI or the Sellers, contact any... representatives...'
hr_edits_data.problem: The phrase 'and procure that no Permitted Recipient will' was deleted. This removes a strict liability obligation on Strada for the actions of its Representatives, which is a favorable change consistent with the preference for efforts-based standards in Low Priority Policy 13.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with Medium Priority Policy 6
hr_edits_data.citation: Context: '...contact any... counterparts of the Group in connection with the Proposed Transaction... ++ You shall not be deemed to have breached this obligation in the event of contact in the ordinary course of business, for other purposes than in connection with the Proposed Transaction. ++'
hr_edits_data.problem: An exception was added to the no-contact clause, permitting contact made in the ordinary course of business for purposes other than the transaction. This is a required modification under Medium Priority Policy 6.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with Medium Priority Policy 7
hr_edits_data.citation: Context: '--The undertakings given by you under this confidentiality agreement are given to the Company but are also for the benefit of each other Provider, as an irrevocable third-party stipulation for no consideration (*onherroepelijk derdenbeding om niet*).--'
hr_edits_data.problem: A clause granting enforceable rights to non-signatories ('each other Provider') as third-party beneficiaries was deleted. This action correctly aligns the agreement with Medium Priority Policy 7, which prohibits such clauses.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with High Priority Policy 2
hr_edits_data.citation: Context: '--You acknowledge and confirm that you are acting on your own behalf and not as agent, nominee, trustee, broker or as part of a syndicate or consortium and that you envisage to consummate the Proposed Transaction yourself in its entirety.--'
hr_edits_data.problem: A clause was deleted that required Strada to act on its own and prohibited it from being part of a syndicate or consortium. The removal of this clause is a mandatory correction under High Priority Policy 2.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with Medium Priority Policy 9
hr_edits_data.citation: Original: '--You shall not directly or indirectly assign or transfer or purport to assign or transfer any of its rights or obligations under this confidentiality agreement without the prior written consent of the Company--.' New: '++You and ++the Company are entitled to assign or transfer (any of its rights under) this confidentiality agreement to any of its affiliates or third parties from time to time.'
hr_edits_data.problem: A one-sided restriction on assignment was replaced with a mutual right for both parties to assign the agreement to their affiliates. This corrects the clause to comply with Medium Priority Policy 9, which states that one-sided restrictions are not acceptable.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with Low Priority Policy 11
hr_edits_data.citation: Original: '...governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of --the Netherlands--... submitted to the exclusive jurisdiction of the --District Court-- in --Amsterdam--...' New: '...governed by... the laws of ++Belgium++. ...submitted to the exclusive jurisdiction of the ++courts++ in ++Antwerp, division Antwerp, Belgium++.'
hr_edits_data.problem: The governing law and jurisdiction were changed from the Netherlands (Amsterdam) to Belgium (Antwerp). This is a positive change that aligns the agreement with Strada's preferred jurisdiction as stated in Low Priority Policy 11.
